properties.media:imagetext:
March
Nineteenth,
1 9 2 7.
Southern Pacific Company,
65 Market Street,
San Francisco.
Gentlemen:
Attention Mir. E. B. Leavitt
The City and County of San Francisco has leased from
the Mills Estate a tract of land on the Bay Shore,
opposite
Lomita Park, in San Mateo County, to be used as an air port.
The lease runs for three years with an option for renewal
for two additional
There is also a possibility that
this site will be selected as a permanent air port site.
We have made arrangements with the City of San Bruno for
a fresh water supply, and
it will be necessary in order to make
a connection with their water system to cross beneath the tracks
of your railroad near Lomita Park station.
am forwarding
herewith a blue print showing the location of
the said water
pipe.
We would like to secure
from your Company
the right or
privilege to maintain this water pipe in the location as shown
the accompanying plan.
I have not prepared any agreement
covering this transaction as I know that you have regular forms
same, and that possibly you would insist on your men
placing the pipe between the two unions that are shown on the
plan.
We are trying to get this air port in shape by
the 5th
as there will be a convention of air men in San Francisco
at that time, and we world apprentin out any dosinanon
and answer.
Very truly yours,
RIGHT OF WAY AGENT.
JUP:KH
375 City Hall.
